comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: ?same place different days news.google.com/newspapers?id=OK4oAAAAIBAJ&sjid=KpIDA... news.google.com/newspapers?id=JHpVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=JJYDA... acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=389100 ... the one with the anchor motif on the sail might be 'Sydney'

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks Quasymody :) I couldn't find (yet) these exact images in our Hall collection but they look too too familiar. We do have a Hall image of spectators on Clark Island similar to the one in Sydney Mail 24 Feb 1926 with a four masted ship in the background, but the media file is very low res so will have to get back to you on that one! It can get a little confusing re the emblems on the mainsail as many vessels used the same symbols (sometimes in different colours - which obv isn't clear in B&W).
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] I do wonder though, if (as a famed livestock and animal photographer) Mr Hall was also at the dog show?!
